intro: Passerina cephalophora, commonly known as the blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and pond edges. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Passerina cephalophora is often found in temperate regions of North America.
